channel.title: 英语 on 飞璠博客
channel.description: Recent content in 英语 on 飞璠博客

item.title: Presentation
item.description:
大二上

主题

What can be learned from a notable figure in the history of electronics or electrical engineering

长度

  1. 8分钟PPT
  2. 2分钟Q&A

PPT 要求！！

  1. 所有的图片标注为image1、…image n
  2. 开头加上参与者拼音名
  3. 倒数第二张必须是图片来源
  4. 最后一张必须是Reference
  5. 所有的source必须是IEEE style
  6. 名称是Pres_slides_Stuednt1SurnameGivenname_Student2SurnameGivenname

PPT内容

  1. 层次清晰，有Introduction,有conclusion
  2. 必须从下面选一个figure，大家不能有重复的
  3. 不能只讲生活和贡献
  4. 必须着重讲他们在Electrical & Electronic Engineering的贡献
  5. 我们能从他们的贡献和经历中学习什么
  • 我们能学习什么
  • 他们如何激励了其他人在该领域的工作
  • 他们具有什么样的精神品质促成了他们的伟大成就
  • 他们遇到了什么困难，面对困难时，他们展示了什么样的精神品质
  • 他们的伟大成就有什么积极的和消极的长期影响
  • 只有他们的成就才能促成的发明、发现有哪些
  • 他们多大程度上单独完成了他们的成就
  • 其他人有多大可能做出相同贡献
  • 他们的早期家庭生活多大程度上影响了他们的成功
  • 他们接受的基础科学教育多大程度上影响了他们的成功
  • 经济援助多大程度上上影响了他们的成功

Sources

  1. 必须paraphrase
  2. 来源
  • UoG Library
  • IEEE Xplore
  • English Text book
  • UESTC library
  • other English Website
  1. 若果用Britannic Academic，必须用以下格式引用

最后

  1. 可以带打印Notes
  2. 记得录视频
  3. 不准用电子产品记笔记

item.title: Group Discussion
item.description:
技巧部分

提出观点

随机

  1. It seems to me that …

  2. Personally, I feel …

  3. Does anyone know…

  4. Have you guys got any idea about…

  5. From my point of view…

补充他人观点

  1. May I adding here?

  2. As you mentioned…

  3. That’s a very good point, and I have an example …

引用观点

  1. According to

  • A book

  • Information on a website

  • An artical in trade public

  • report

  • lecture

  • video

提问

弄清他人意图

  1. So, you mean …

  2. So, what you are saying is …

  3. Sorry, I didn’t quite catch(follow) you. Could you please repeat that?

打断他人

完全同意

  1. I can’t agree with you more…

  2. I totally agree with you.

不完全同意

  1. That’s true, but …

  2. Well, that might be correct …

  3. Yes, but …

完全不同意

  1. I’m sorry, but the point that … might not be correct

  2. Sorry, but SOMEBODY said the opposite of that…

  3. A lot of people1 made that claim, but research published in IEEE … found that …

你话太多

  1. Sorry to say so, but you know, our time is limited.

Summary

  • 适当总结，推进话题

大二上考试内容

Main Text - E-waste: A Global Issue

  1. E-devices $\uparrow \Rightarrow$ E-waste $\uparrow$ in the past 50 years $\Rightarrow$ Human Health & Enviroment $\downarrow$

  2. Both in Developed and Developing Countries

stateDiagram state Report_of_United_Nations_University{ 2014 --> 2016(45Mt): %5 increase 2016(45Mt) --> 2021(52Mt): Predict } state India{ 2006 --> 2010: doubled }
  1. Factors

  • Economic growth

  • Digital revolution

  • Price of e-deivces $\downarrow$

  • Lifespan of e-devices $\downarrow$

  1. Solution
stateDiagram E_devices --> Enviroment: toxic substances Enviroment --> Human_Health: hurt
  • Envirionment: nearby water,air,ground
  1. Recycle expensive $\Rightarrow$ Developed send e-waste to developing countries

  • International agreement: Restrict th e amount of waste being sent to developing countries

  • US don’t sign up these agreements

  1. Stop sending trash to developing countries !!!
  • Governments need more actions!!!

Text 3 Unfair e-Waste Trade in Africa

  1. 可以具体化为jouranlists, writers等 ↩︎
